definition[0]: to kill someone by pressing their throat with your hands, a rope etc
example[0]: The victim had been strangled with a belt.
definition[1]: to limit or prevent the growth or development of something
example[1]: Mills argues that high taxation strangles the economy.
example[2]: The strangle would be profitable if the stock price moves out of the 372p-444p range before expiry of the options on Nov 19.
